Community Guidelines

These guidelines help ensure respectful and appropriate use of the Indigenous Art Atlas. Please read them carefully before contributing or using content from our platform.

Cultural Respect and Sensitivity

Sacred and Ceremonial Content

  • Never photograph or document sacred sites without explicit permission from traditional custodians
  • Respect restrictions on viewing or sharing ceremonial artwork
  • When in doubt, consult with local indigenous communities or cultural centers
  • Use privacy settings appropriately for sensitive locations

Attribution and Recognition

  • Always credit known artists and communities when possible
  • Acknowledge traditional custodians of the land where artwork is located
  • Provide cultural context when submitting contemporary pieces
  • Respect intellectual property rights of living artists

Submission Guidelines

Quality Standards

  • Submit high-quality, clear photographs
  • Include accurate location information (when appropriate)
  • Provide detailed descriptions and cultural context
  • Ensure proper lighting and minimal visual obstructions

Required Information

  • Artwork title (or descriptive name if title unknown)
  • Type of artwork (cave art, mural, sculpture, etc.)
  • Estimated time period or cultural context
  • Current condition assessment
  • Location notes and access information

Privacy and Location Guidelines

Sensitive Locations

Important: Some indigenous art sites are sacred or culturally sensitive. Use appropriate privacy levels:
  • Public: Exact location can be shared publicly
  • Approximate: Show general area only (within 1km radius)
  • Region: Show broader regional location only
  • Hidden: No location information displayed publicly

Private Land

  • Always obtain permission before accessing or photographing art on private property
  • Mark submissions as "Private Land" to inform other users
  • Include access information or contact details when appropriate
  • Respect "No Trespassing" signs and property boundaries

Community Standards

Acceptable Use

  • Educational and research purposes
  • Cultural preservation and documentation
  • Respectful sharing with proper attribution
  • Community engagement and collaboration

Prohibited Activities

  • Commercial use without proper permissions
  • Disrespectful or inappropriate commentary
  • Sharing exact locations of sensitive sites
  • Vandalism or damage to documented artwork
  • Copyright infringement

Reporting and Moderation

How to Report Issues

If you encounter inappropriate content, cultural insensitivity, or technical issues:

  • Use the "Report" function on individual artworks
  • Contact our moderation team through the Contact page
  • Provide specific details about the concern
  • Include cultural context if relevant to the issue

Response Process

  • All reports are reviewed within 48 hours
  • Cultural advisors are consulted for sensitive matters
  • Appropriate actions taken based on guidelines
  • Reporters receive updates on resolution

Legal Considerations

Copyright and Intellectual Property

  • Respect copyright of contemporary artists
  • Understand traditional cultural protocols
  • Obtain proper permissions for commercial use
  • Credit sources appropriately

Data Protection

  • Personal information is protected according to privacy laws
  • Location data is handled with appropriate security measures
  • Users can request data removal or modification
  • Sensitive cultural information receives additional protection

Need Help?

If you have questions about these guidelines or need assistance with submissions, please don't hesitate to contact us. We're here to support respectful documentation and sharing of indigenous art heritage.
